lines.text: Spy on my parents? You gotta be kidding me! You want me to help you put'em away? Never!
Look Mr. F.B.I man, if you're so sure and if you're so right, why don't you just arrest them?
Well, because... they haven't done anything yet.
You manipulating son of a bitch!
Don't give me that crap! You're out for yourself! The big caller, the major bust, the two-bit g-man, well shove it up you're ass! You're not my father. You're not even my friend.
What's my name? Come on dad, what could the head of the grandfamily have to hide from his first and oldest and only son?

[pause]
Nika.
J. Nicholas Grant. Nick.

[shakes head]
Nikita.
The time has come.
I told you, we're not ready.
You had 20 years to get ready.
Shove this up your bladder Boris.
You know Roy? Russians don't shoot their children.

[Referring to a buxom servicewoman named Corporal Hogan]
Sometimes I slip up and call her Corporal "Hogans."

[shaking Jeff's hand]
You got a wet palm there, son. What's a matter? Nervous?
Do you have a file on Jeffrey Grant?
What kind of file?
Grades... extra-curricular activities. Going back, say, a couple of years.
Why would I show you Jeffrey Grant's file?
I'm FBI.
You could be NFL for all I care.
Please?
How'd a pretty girl like you get mixed up in guidance counseling?
How'd a nice guy like you get mixed up in the FBl?
You ever guided any students towards the Bureau, Verna?
l hope not.
How about me guiding you towards dinner?
What the hell kind of investigation is this, anyway? Are you going to tell me or aren't you?
You're asking all the right questions, Jeff. Something big is coming down.
Jeffrey Nicholas Grant.
Well, that sounds official.
Your parents are Russian spies. Your parents are KGB agents. "Sleepers," they're called.
Deep cover. They blend with the country they're assigned to. Own homes, hold jobs, raise families. They sleep for years. But when they awake, they're lethal.
Let's go back to your Air Force Academy investigation. What happened to that?
What about it?
What happened to your investigation?
There wasn't any.
Richard and Elizabeth Grant entered this country through Canada. Took their IDs off headstones in the Spokane Cemetery. Three years later, you were born. Wanna' see your birth certificate?
No, thanks.
Sure you don't want some chips? I exist on corn chips and jalapeños. Not too swift around a stove.
What time will you be home?
5, 6... something like that.
Could you be a little more specific? I get tired of cooking dinner twice.

[walks in on his high school guidance counselor and Roy in bed]
Ms. McLaughlin! Is this work experience?
Go out in the yard! I'll be out in a minute.

[to Verna, sheepishly]
Life's little surprises...
No problem. I'll just go topless for the rest of the student body.
You gotta' be crazy to bring a child into this ugly world.
What's so hard about it?
Making a buck. Raising a family. Keeping it all together takes talent. Love.

[addressing Elizabeth and Richard Grant - Soviet sleeper agents]
Your discipline is sorely wanting. The Directorate will be most unhappy. You must go to work immediately.
Do you have another cigarette, Konstantin?
You smoke, Nikita? What would the Surgeon General say?

[continues]
Russian cigarettes. You will acquire the taste, Nikita. As you will for all things Russian.
I once had some Popov Vodka.
Did you? Bully for you, Nikita! What a guy!
I would never give up a man who killed my partner.
You never *had* a partner!
Were you troubled at home, Roy?
I had a great home!
I can't imagine you as a kid...
Oh, I was a wonderful kid.
What'd your father do?
Cop.
Good cop or bad cop?
Bad cop... Wouldn't kiss ass. Good father.
